intro: Psychotria hosokawae, commonly known as the Hosokawa Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. While not widely cultivated, it holds ecological significance in its native habitat.
